description: DES MOINES, Iowa, Sept. 29 (UPI) The Iowa Civil Liberties Union said today that it would drop a lawsuit seeking to ban a school holiday for Pope John Paul II's visit. Instead, the group said it would concentrate on preventing a holiday for county employees.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: In Many Crucial Ways, Labor Will Miss Meany's Iron Hand
description: So, after all the years, he will be gone. George Meany, with his blunt attacks on capitalists and communists and Presidents. George Meany, cigar and all, taking the sun (in hat and slippers) beside a Miami Beach pool; or hunching over in front of the microphones, peering through his glasses at inquisitors with an air of glum disdain.

title: Yanks Sink Jays, 94, As John Posts No. 21
description: While Reggie Jackson and Jim Spencer provided some serious undertones to a meaningless game, Manager Billy Martin added a touch of levity to the Yankees nexttolast game of the season yesterday by finally putting his best outfielder, Ron Guidry, in center field for part of the ninth inning.

title: A Legend Returns After 39 Years
description: She has played fourhand piano with Gabriel Faur; taken long, leisurely Paris walks with Maurice Ravel ; discussed musical form and religion with Vincent D'Indy and talked of love, music and Proust with Reynaldo Hahn. For some 20 years she was the adored friend and pupil of Alfred Cortot, and, when she began to concertize, played under the batons of Furtwngler, Stokowski, Barbirolli, Van Beinum, Monteux and Munch.

title: THE ELECTRONIC HOME
description: Forecasting the future, as any weatherman or stockbroker will testify, is risky business. But in the area of home electronics, the main trends to characterize the early 1980's are already emerging clearly. New technologies in the form of videodiscs and miniaturized audio components presage a new breed of artistically communicative hardware that is likely to make the living room a primary showplace for the performing arts.

title: Jackson Goes to Bat for City High School Coaches
description: Reggie Jackson, the New York Yankees baseball slugger, and Mayor Koch opened a fundraising drive yesterday to supplement the salaries of New York City high school coaches, who are conducting a job action that has stopped most varsity sports.

title: CONNECTICUT JOURNAL I
description: THE movement among some Democrats to persuade Senator Edward M. Kennedy of Massachusetts to run for President has officially come to Connecticut.

title: The Convenient Man
description: IN those faraway, dreamy days of Empire, when successive American administrations were bearing any burden, supporting any friend, opposing any foe, to assure the survival and success of freedom everywhere, et cetera, Aillai Stevenson was their durable proconsul. A man of convenience! How convenient he must have seemed to John F. Kennedy, who dispatched Arthur Schlesinger and Tracy Barnes to lie to him about the origins and purposes of the invasion at the Bay of Pigs. A snap! They could lie to Adlai, and Adlai could retell the lies to the General Assembly with conviction, because he did not know they were lies. It must have contributed to the general merriment when later it was written, and written again, that the invasion failed because Adlai Stevenson convinced the President to cancel the air strikes so vital to the success of the invasion. Insiders knew that he hadn't been consulted in any way.

title: Excerpts From Homilies Pope John Paul II Delivered in Drogheda and in Dublin
description: DUBLIN, Sept. 29  Following are excerpts from the homily delivered Pope John Paul II at Drogheda, north of Dublin, on the opening day of his trip Ireland, as recorded by The New York Times, and excerpts from the homily delivered by the Pope at Phoenix Park in Dublin, as distributed by the Vatican.

title: State Consulting Job to Hongisto
description: ALBANY, Sept. 29  Richard D. Hongisto, who resigned in June as Acting Commissioner of the state's Department of Correctional Services after a lengthy political battle over his confirmation, has been named as a $200aday consultant to the state's Division of Criminal Justice Services.

title: Legacy of Courage
description: THE Roots craze persists, and today's woman often feels, like Alex Haley, the need to explore her past and thus illumine her present, the need to reconstruct her personal history.

title: Rise in Moral Standard Cited in Delaying Trial
description: DES MOINES, Iowa, Sept. 29  A criminal trial scheduled for next week has been delayed because of the higher standard of morality that might exist in Des Moines as a result of the Pope's fourhour visit Thursday.

title: The Visitor and the Visited
description: Catholic Boston, they say, is going crazy. New York's Jewish mayor orders a tickertape parade to pay proper tribute. In Protestant Des Moines, a leading newspaper ran the banner headline, Proud Iowa Awaits the Pope, five weeks ago. As someone there remarked, The Pope's the only guy I know who they'll block a freeway for out in this country. America is about to welcome John Paul II with exceptional warmth and ceremony. It is a reception that will tell much about change both in the papacy and in ourselves.

title: 2 Wyoming Families Take on Mobil Oil Co. Over Hydrogen Sulfide
description: BIG PINEY, Wyo., Sept. 29 (UPI) When the Fenns and the Haddocks of rural Sublette County complained that hydrogen sulfide was being emitted by a nearby Mobil oilfield, the company sent each of them a 35pound gas mask and a 30minute oxygen bottle.

title: Decorative Harvest From Dried Gourds
description: Squash, pumpkins, cucumbers are coming forth with abundance. For me the most delightful of all are their petite cousins, the gourds. They are easy to grow and their decorative markings and colorings are fun to select. Those who had no garden space to raise their own can usually find gourds at vegetable stands and supermarkets.

title: 4Year Term For Board Faces Test
description: IT'S an open secret, Legislator Carolyn L. Whittle said angrily last week. We're not getting the airport problem solved, and we won't have decision on Playland  because of the election. It's a shame.
